review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] So comfy! This sweatshirt is so soft on the inside, and just the right length to where it doesn’t make you look bulky at the hip. The fit is perfect.
review.name: So comfy!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Hoodie is very plush inside. It’s true that the level of softness is more than you’d expect. I’m looking forward to staying warm in it on chilly days. I got the copper color and it looks nice. Only downside is that it’ll probably look dirtier faster than the black one. I think it runs a little big. True, I should be a size large … but the size large was just a tad too large in the chest and the sleeves are too long. Sizing down may have been too tight at the hips, but I feel like I’d prefer a tighter fit. Regardless, I love the hoodie and recommend it.
review.name: Cozy Warmth

review.reviewBody: This is a brighter olive green shade for "Military Green" and it is very flattering if you have a more Mediterranean or Olive coloring.  The inside is one of the softest and coziest I have experience for a hoodie.  The size guide suggests I get a M but I ordered a Small.  I tried both on and they both work but I prefer a trimmer fit.  The body is quite boxy/square and I am smaller there so didn't want all the fabric.
review.name: So  Cozy and Soft Inside

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is seriously comfortable! I first ordered the Peaks Hoody and didn't reorder size-wise because it felt stiff and bulky to me. I've had non-marmot sweats that piled terribly (100% polyester) after a couple wears, so I searched piling, raschel, and compared specs. The Rowan has 3% elastane for some stretch but doesn't bag out. The hood lies down. The description of the lining is true-plush, high pile, soft, cozy. It comes out of the laundry looking new and NO PILING. Friends liked mine so much they had to get one. All I did was tie the hood strings in a loop so they don't dangle in my pup's eyes when I bend over to hug her.  I'm very happy with this Rowan hoody.
review.name: Best Sweatshirt I've Ever Had

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this hoody! It has comfy sweatshirt vibes, but is so much better than a typical sweatshirt. I didn't realize when buying it that the inside was going to be so soft - it's a lovely fleece that feels so good on my skin. I also appreciate the relaxed fit and relatively sleek pocket design. I chose the military green color, which is a little less brown/more green than expected from the pictures, but I like it.
review.name: It's what's on the inside that counts.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Super cozy and warm. Love the lining and the style. Great sale price!
review.name: Cozy and cute!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Super warm! Only complaint is the material is a fuzz magnet but still my go-to hoodie!
review.name: great quality

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this hoody in copper. It is a nice quality but the cut is weird and so plain.  To bag on top - returning it.
review.name: Weird shape
comment:
Hello,
Thank you for providing us with feedback on the hoody. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention.

I am very sorry to hear that the design has not met your expectations.

We will make sure to forward your idea and feedback to an appropriate department, so that we may think about an appropriate solution for the future. Thank you so much for sharing your opinion with us.

If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via [URL-https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us] or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon.-Fri. 9am-5pm Eastern Time.
Thank you! Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: I ride in an urban environment so, stopping and starting is a big part of my ride. These shoes allow me to start off without being clipped in. No more torn-up ankles from slick bottomed shoes! And, I can walk around my house without putting holes in my wood floors. Comfortable and cool. Also, half the price of my last bike shoes!
review.name: The perfect solution...

review.reviewBody: This was my first road shoe with Velcro fasteners. They work well for the price point and are fairly comfortable.  They are, IMO, sized larger so the Velcro comes in handy.
review.name: Good shoe!

review.reviewBody: While I find these a bit wide (I have a narrow foot, however), they adjust to fit, the length is good, and it's really handy to be able to loosen/tighten with the Velcro straps while riding -- clip-in perfectly to my Shimano 2-bolt pedals.  Decent look overall, like the rubberized bottoms so I don't slide on my floor on the way out to ride.  The sole is quite stiff -- feet hurt after riding, but maybe adjusting the position on the cleat will help with that. UPDATE: Just too wide for me, had to return even though they are pretty nice.
review.name: Overall, a good shoe

name: All-Road v5 Cycling Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody:
I bought these gloves and have only used them on a few ski trips (7 ski days in 14 days of ownership) and the leather on the tips has holes in it. I think this is the classic case of women's items not being made for the rigor of activity like men's gloves. Backcountry is very nice and is giving me a full refund but I will be ordering the men's Army Leather ones.

They are warm and if you're just using them to do light skiing/outdoor work they'll be great.
review.name: Fine Gloves but didn't hold up

review.reviewBody:
I really like this glove for skiing but please order a size up if you plan to wear a liner. I originally got an 8 and it was kinda tight without a liner. Then I returned and ordered a 9 and it?s perfect with my liner and without my liner it?s not too big. 
The snow guard come up really high which is nice and I find the different adjusters help make the glove fit well for me. 
For sure recommended ? but one size up from your measured size.
review.name: Really Quality Glove

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam X Hierro v7 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: The trainer is brilliant as far as it’s waterproof , sturdy but extremely light on your foot and looks attractive too .  The only thing I would say is that it does come up small I am a good 5 1/2 to 6 and I brought a 6 1/2 . They still were really tight and as I needed them for a marathon hike I looked up for a wide fitting. No wide fitting so brought another style ( new balance) which wasn’t as sturdy and it came in a wide fitting . I wore those ones for the marathon hike but they became so loose in training as a wide fitting I had to put a sports insole in and then they were fine   I think it is the gortex material and the strong sealed band around them that makes these really snug but I can happily do 13k ok in them not a marathon though .
review.name: Very snug but a great hiking trainer

It's comfortable, light, and easy to open/close when wearing. I use it to keep day hike essentials in and it fits everything perfectly. review.reviewBody: Bought this bag for a deployment. I like the size, shape, the padding on the yoke and back panel (the back panel holds the body well) are as great as the rest of the reviews say honestly. I really like the mesh pockets but i wish they didnt take up room inside pack (they bulge internally). The load baring straps are great. The buckles slide easily when not under load. I got the green colour and it is darker than the pictures online suggest. The things that would make it better would be air flow around the back panel, the zipper should go all the way to the bottom, the size bottle pouches arent elastic and the Catalyst 22 doesnt like nalgene bottles but the camelbak ones fit good. Also it would be nice to have a feed through hole for bladders. Other that the mentioned issues above it is fantastic! It would be nice to see it in cool colours and make the black colour all black instead of orange
review.name: Almost there!

review.reviewBody: I researched bags for months to find one that could safely hold my laptop and work stuff, while still keeping out the elements and working on the trails. This pack is the perfect fit. I work in parks and the office and now only need one bag.
review.name: Do it all pack!

review.reviewBody:
I bought this bag after taking my 17" work laptop (Dell Precision 7760) to a local retailer and trying to fit it into various bags. The ironic part is I had previously ordered a Catalyst 26 which did not fit this laptop due to the zipper path above the laptop pocket. The 22 has the laptop in the main compartment and just enough freedom on the zippers to fit it in there. 
As a disclaimer, a laptop of this size is not intended to fit in this backpack, which is stated in other comments, and I may have just gotten lucky by getting a backpack with enough tolerance to make it fit.

I have greatly enjoyed this backpack though after owning it for a week. I use it as my main pack when bike commuting 30 min to work. I can fit a laptop, notebook, various writing utensils, laptop charger, headset, change of shirt, light lunch, bike lock, and bike cable. At this point, the backpack is maxed out on capacity. I wish I would have been able to fit the laptop in the 26 as this would have been the perfect amount of extra space for my daily routine. 
My only wish is that the pockets on the side were able to accommodate a larger water bottle. They can fit a standard .5 L bottle but that is about it. My go-to is generally a Nalgene and this is just too big. Instead, I use the pockets for sunglasses, wallet, and keys.
review.name: Commuter Day Bag

review.reviewBody: I've had this bag for roughly 2 weeks and appreciate the compact ergonomic design that it has while retaining economical use of space in the design. Easy to wear and still carries my work computer and EDC items needed.
review.name: Compact and excellent use of space.

review.reviewBody: I bought this a month ago and when it arrived the zipper has issues making it hard to zip up and down. I started the warranty process but decided that was a bigger hassle than the zipper so I’m keeping the back. Storage wasn’t as big as I was expecting, and there’s not a lot too it, but seems like a decent bag.
review.name: Backpack is ok

review.reviewBody:
I anxiously awaited the release of this pack as the outgoing urban assault 21 looked awesome, just lacked exterior water bottle pockets which is a necessity to me. As others have mentioned, the middle zip no longer goes all the way to the bottom, reducing its usefulness. Not a huge deal, but certainly a downgrade. The top "brain" pocket is a little tough getting your hand in and out of, but never had the UA21 to compare. The bag also sits a bit funny on my back, something to do with how the panels are laid out it seems, it just looks a bit awkward.
Lastly, and the most disappointing, the water bottle pockets. Too loose for smaller bottles, too tight for the classic Nalgene. Why oh why wasn't a quality stretch material used?!
I know this is a recent release, but I really hope these issues are addressed because this one just misses the mark for my EDC use.
Some positives: -looks great while not on my back
-black with orange interior is awesome
-comfortable
-good size for EDC
review.name: Wanted to love it

review.reviewBody: My last 3 backpacks kept having the zippers break. This one holds up great. Very durable.
review.name: Awesome backpack

review.reviewBody: Great pack overall but big fail on the water bottle pockets. You can’t fit any standard bottles in them. The bottle has to be very slim to be able to use the pockets.
review.name: Great EDC pack except….

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love my Catalyst 22. I recently had a 3 day visit out of state and only took this bag, and it was just perfect to fit all my stuff, including a hoodie I had bought for my Mom. I only wish I had went ahead and bout the 26 instead. But since my main usage of the bag will be for school, I think this bag will get the job done just fine. The material is awesome and noticeably strong. I love the Triple Zipper system, as it makes accessing the bag easy. For example, if you have something in the bottom of the bag, and you don't want to empty all the contents, you can just open the vertical zipper, and reach into the bottom, without messing up your stuff. If there was any critique I would give this bag, it's the water bottle pockets on the sides. I wish they were just a little bit larger and had some stretch to them like my wife's bag does. Other than that, I really enjoy this pack and it was incredibly comfortable to walk around the airport with during my trip because of the padding and adjustments in the straps. 10/10 would recommend.
review.name: This bag rocks

review.reviewBody: I was super excited to get this pack. 3 zip design similar to the Urban Assault, slightly larger and with water bottle pockets! The top stash pocket is more narrow and my hand (smaller female hands) have a thought time getting anything out and get scraped by the zipper going in and out. The inside laptop compartment is floated, which I appreciate, but is lacking the Velcro strap that is in the Urban Assault to secure the laptop. And the water bottle pockets… the feature I was most excited about… they don’t hold even a standard Nalgene bottle. If they had, I would have dealt with the other features I felt were a downgrade, just so I could have the 3 zip design in an EDC. But unfortunately, I had to return.
review.name: Great idea in theory

name: Catalyst 22 Backpack

review.reviewBody: I bought a pair similar to these about 15 ro 20 years ago and I adore them. I wanted replacements because the originals are showing their age. I suspect these are the "updated" version of my original pair of gloves. I am disappointed with the new "replacements" as they do not seem to be as well constructed nor does it appear that the same care was taken with with their construction. The only bright spot is they were not expensive as they were on clearance.
review.name: Wanted replacements

review.reviewBody: They seem warm enough. They seem well constructed.
review.name: They seem warm enough. They

review.reviewBody: The fit and high quality make these a perfect match for any light winter activity. Warm at 10 degrees F and the fleece is very flexible. A great buy!
review.name: Great fitting gloves

review.reviewBody: I bought these as liners for my heavy duty ski mits but have ended up just using them as my everyday wear.  I ride my bike a couple miles everyday commuting in boston and these are great.  I went with an XL and they are roomy enough for a light liner underneath.  I tried wearing them once as a liner with mittens and it was pretty snug (XXL mits) but I do not think that is their intended purpose.  Recommend as daily gloves were getting wet is not a concern.
review.name: Great Gloves

review.reviewBody: Preformed great while skinning in cold weather. Kept my hands warm while allowing moisture to escape. Throwing a shell mit on at the top and during the decent worked great.
review.name: Warm and breathable

review.reviewBody: Purchased these gloves to replace a similar pair of Black Diamond gloves which had worn thru in a couple of the fingers.  These are really warm.  Time will tell how well they hold up.
review.name: Warmth . . . ahhhhh

review.reviewBody: Have barely two months of light winter use, not involving any hard contact, (skiing, shoveling, etc) and the stitching at almost every the finger base is already separating. Perhaps BD is sourcing from cheaper factories to keep costs low, but the loss of a quality reputation will ultimately be much more expensive for this brand.
review.name: Nice design, poor execution.

review.reviewBody: I only used this glove for one day of ski touring, after which I noticed a decent hole had formed where the stitching had come apart between the thumb and pointer finger area. There were also a couple of loose threads on the palm.  Pretty poor, especially when you consider the retail price of this glove. A shame as the glove did fit well and were warm at least.. I swapped my pair for another brand's glove.
review.name: Hole after one days use
comment: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our Midweight Fleece Gloves.  We have a 100% satisfaction guaranteed warranty for our apparel, you can file a warranty claim with us here (https://warranty.bdel.com/CreateCase/StepOne).

review.reviewBody: As a comfortable fleece glove with extra durability, they're great. However, BD glove sizing is so inconsistent between models that I would recommend trying these on before you buy. For instance, in size XL,  these liner gloves are a full effective size bigger than the Torrent gloves, which you would expect they could be paired with, given that those come with removable midweight fleece gloves of their own. They fit about 1.5 sizes bigger than the Guide gloves, and about a size bigger than the Soloist 3-finger gloves. They're no longer in the fingers than the 'heavyweight' Impulse gloves, but much higher volume in the fingers. So, that's 4 stars for a solid fleece glove, minus 1 star for inconsistent sizing, minus 1 for a poor value if you have to return them due to said sizing. A person with huge hands and no expectations regarding fit relative to other products would probably be completely satisfied. Simply changing the size labeling would fix the problem. Hope this sizing info helps!
review.name: Crazy sizing

review.reviewBody: Not as warm as I thought. A thumb seam was torn. Did not ask for a replacement.
review.name: Expectations Not Met

name: Midweight Fleece Glove

review.reviewBody: Probably the worst Targhees I have ever had. I loved the III, the II was great. These shoes were not comfortable, no matter how much I broke them in. It was a good thing I bought 3 pairs of the III's.

review.reviewBody: These fit perfectly and my husband wore them most of the day after putting them on the first time. Love Keen boots!
review.name: Feel great!

review.itemreviewed: Targhee IV Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It cuts across the top of my foot when I lace them and walk. My other shoes had two hooks. These have one hook and one more eye which is in the wrong spot for me. They just don’t fit the same. I gave him two weeks.
review.name: It cuts across the top

review.itemreviewed: Targhee IV Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: That's what it feels like for me every day. Walking on Pillows. I have flat (No arches) big feet (size 15) at 5'10 (almost my whole life big feet) and these are the most comfortable wearing shoes and boots (that's right, I bought 2 different models)
review.name: Walking on Pillows

name: Targhee IV Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody:
I used to think it wasn't that bad taking my mitten off and letting it hang from the string to get my phone out or whatever... but after riding in these... i was a fool. i now know convenience i previously could not imagine. 
I love the weight of these mitts. I love the super grippy palm. I love the big easy to use zipper. 
from now on you can catch me in these mitts 
I would size down if you're in doubt at all. in Dakine & Crab grab a medium fits great in these guys i could wear a medium but small feels better.
review.name: I'm totally obsessed.

name: Ghoul Mitten
